headline.main: Economic Toll of Diabetes Begins Early

docs.abstract: Diabetes may be more than a hazard to health. A new study shows that young adults with the disease have lower lifetime earnings and fewer job prospects than their peers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Diabetes may be more than a hazard to health. A new study shows that young adults with the disease have lower lifetime earnings and fewer job prospects than their peers.
docs.snippet: Diabetes may be more than a hazard to health. A new study shows that young adults with the disease have lower lifetime earnings and fewer job prospects than their peers.

headline.seo: Young, Obese and Getting Weight-Loss Surgery

docs.abstract: Along with the obesity epidemic in America has come an explosion in weight-loss surgery, most recently among young people; push toward surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic to operate on patients whose bodies might still be developing (Series: The Big Picture).
docs.lead_paragraph: The push toward operations like Lap-Band surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic on patients whose bodies might still be developing.
docs.snippet: The push toward operations like Lap-Band surgery on the young has brought some resistance from doctors who say it is too drastic on patients whose bodies might still be developing.

headline.seo: A Poverty Solution That Starts With a Hug
headline.print_headline: A Poverty Solution That Starts With a Hug
headline.main: A Poverty Solution That Starts With a Hug

docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column notes that the American Academy of Pediatrics will issue a landmark warning that toxic stress produced by abuse or neglect in early childhood can harm the child for life; asserts that the statement has revolutionary implications for medicine and for how to more effectively chip away at poverty and crime.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Academy of Pediatrics is warning that a harsh early environment can lay the groundwork for lifelong achievement gaps, health problems and poverty.
docs.snippet: The American Academy of Pediatrics is warning that a harsh early environment can lay the groundwork for lifelong achievement gaps, health problems and poverty.
